s.text: So I complained about this prospect, and before long we were back to the default situation: chronic late payment.
In the summer of 1989, apparently responding to my endless lamentations about late payments, AP started paying me ahead of time, i.e., a few days before the first of the month.
So I complained about this prospect, and before long we were back to the default situation: chronic late payment.
It seemed doubly odd when months came where the secretary forgot to put the requisition through.
To be fair, there was only one "did-we-pay-you-this-month?"
The woman I spoke to coolly asked how much I made as a writer, judged the amount too high to warrant condolences, and said I should be glad to pay my share.
